revision.comment: Disambiguating links to [[Phoenix Racing]] (link changed to [[Phoenix Racing (NASCAR team)]]) using [[User:Qwertyytrewqqwerty/DisamAssist|DisamAssist]].
revision.text:
{{NASCAR race season infobox | Type = NAS | country = United States | Race Name = Autism Speaks 400 presented by Hershey's Milk & Milkshakes | Details ref = <ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nascar.com/2010/news/headlines/cup/05/14/mtruexjr.dover.pole/index.html |title=Truex Wins Pole |date=14 May 2010 |location=[[NASCAR]] |accessdate=14 May 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100518044357/http://www.nascar.com/2010/news/headlines/cup/05/14/mtruexjr.dover.pole/index.html| archivedate= 18 May 2010 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref><ref name="kyle" /> | Fulldate = {{Start date|2010|May|16}} | Year = 2010 | Race_No = 12 | Season_No = 36 | Image = Dover International Speedway.PNG | Caption = Layout of Dover International Speedway | Location = [[Dover International Speedway]] [[Dover, Delaware]] | Official name = Autism Speaks 400 | Course_mi = 1.0 | Course_km = 1.61 | Distance_laps = 400 | Distance_mi = 400 | Distance_km = 643.74 | Weather = Partly cloudy with a high of 75; wind out of the NE at 8 mph. | Avg = {{convert|126|mi/h}} | Pole_Driver = [[Martin Truex, Jr.]] | Pole_Team = [[Michael Waltrip Racing]] | Pole_Time = 22.884 | Most_Driver = [[Jimmie Johnson]] | Most_Team = [[Hendrick Motorsports]] | Most_laps = 225 | Car = 18 | First_Driver = [[Kyle Busch]] | First_Team = [[Joe Gibbs Racing]] | Network = [[Fox Broadcasting Company]] | Announcers = [[Mike Joy]], [[Darrell Waltrip]] and [[Larry McReynolds]] }} The '''2010 Autism Speaks 400 presented by Hershey's Milk & Milkshakes''' was the twelfth race of the 2010 NASCAR [[Sprint Cup Series]] season at [[Dover International Speedway]] in [[Dover, Delaware]]. It started at 1 p.m. EST on May 16, 2010. The 2010 Autism Speaks 400 was televised on [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]] and was broadcast on MRN radio at 12 p.m.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nascar.com/races/cup/|title=Sprint Cup Series Schedule|publisher=NASCAR|accessdate=27 March 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100328091316/http://www.nascar.com/races/cup/?| archivedate= 28 March 2010 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref> [[Martin Truex, Jr.]] started in the pole position.<ref name="truex">{{cite news|url=http://www.usatoday.com/sports/motor/2010-05-14-2018783357_x.htm|title=Truex Wins The Pole At Dover|date=14 May 2010|publisher=Dan Gelston|accessdate=15 May 2010|location=[[USA Today]]}}</ref> The race had eight different leaders, twenty lead changes, and five cautions.<ref name="race trax">{{cite web|url=http://msn.foxsports.com/nascar/cup/raceTrax?gameId=20100516004&state=RACE|title=Race Information|accessdate=16 May 2010|location=[[Fox Sports (USA)|Fox Sports]]| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100519104159/http://msn.foxsports.com/nascar/cup/raceTrax?gameId=20100516004&state=RACE| archivedate= 19 May 2010 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref> The winner of the race was [[Kyle Busch]],<ref name="kyle">{{cite news|title=Kyle Busch Wins Dover|url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2010/racing/05/16/nascar.dover.ap/index.html|accessdate=16 May 2010|location=[[Sports Illustrated]]|date=16 May 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100519134858/http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2010/racing/05/16/nascar.dover.ap/index.html?| archivedate= 19 May 2010 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=RjwilmsiBot}}</ref> while [[Jeff Burton]] and [[Matt Kenseth]] finished second and third respectively.
==Race report==
===Practices and qualifying=== [[Image:MartinTruexJrAugust2007.jpg|thumb|left|220px|Polesitter [[Martin Truex, Jr.]] in 2007.]] On May 14, 2010, the quickest drivers in first practice were [[Jimmie Johnson]], [[Clint Bowyer]], [[Kasey Kahne]], [[Martin Truex, Jr.]], and [[Kyle Busch]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nascar.com/races/cup/2010/12/data/practice1_speeds.html |title=Practice 1 Results |date=14 May 2010 |location=NASCAR |accessdate=14 May 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100517125128/http://www.nascar.com/races/cup/2010/12/data/practice1_speeds.html| archivedate= 17 May 2010 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref> During qualifying, Martin Truex, Jr. won the [[pole position]], while Kasey Kahne, [[Mark Martin]], Kyle Busch, and Jimmie Johnson started in the two rows behind him.<ref name="qual">{{cite web |url=http://www.nascar.com/races/cup/2010/12/data/lineup.html |title=Qualifying Results |date=14 May 2010 |location=NASCAR |accessdate=14 May 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100517125123/http://www.nascar.com/races/cup/2010/12/data/lineup.html| archivedate= 17 May 2010 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref> Also in qualifying, two drivers did not qualify; they were [[Todd Bodine]] and [[Max Papis]].<ref name= "qual"/> On May 15, 2010, the quickest in the second practice were Jimmie Johnson, [[David Ragan]], Kyle Busch, Clint Bowyer, and Kasey Kahne.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nascar.com/races/cup/2010/12/data/practice2_speeds.html |title=Practice 2 Results |date=15 May 2010 |location=NASCAR |accessdate=15 May 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100518044437/http://www.nascar.com/races/cup/2010/12/data/practice2_speeds.html| archivedate= 18 May 2010 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref> In the final practice the quickest were Kyle Busch, [[Denny Hamlin]], [[Carl Edwards]], [[A. J. Allmendinger]], and Clint Bowyer.<ref>{{cite web|title=Practice 3 Results|url=http://www.nascar.com/races/cup/2010/12/data/practice3_speeds.html|accessdate=16 May 2010|location=NASCAR|date=15 May 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100518044442/http://www.nascar.com/races/cup/2010/12/data/practice3_speeds.html| archivedate= 18 May 2010 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref>
===Race summary=== To begin the pre-race ceremonies, Reverend [[Jonathan Falwell]] of [[Thomas Road Baptist Church]] in Lynchburg, Va., delivered the [[invocation]]. Then, country music artist, [[Joe Nichols]] performed the [[U.S. National Anthem|national anthem]]. To start the engines, [[Richard Petty]], part of the inaugural class at the [[NASCAR Hall of Fame]], gave the command, "Gentlemen, start your engines!"<ref name="summ">{{cite web|title=Race Summary|url=http://www.nascar.com/2010/races/lapbylap/05/16/lap.by.lap.dover/index.html|accessdate=16 May 2010|location=NASCAR|date=16 May 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100519104009/http://www.nascar.com/2010/races/lapbylap/05/16/lap.by.lap.dover/index.html| archivedate= 19 May 2010 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref>
At 1:17 p.m. EDT, the [[Racing_flags#Green flag|green flag]] waved with [[Martin Truex, Jr.]] the leader. On the same lap, though, [[Kasey Kahne]], who started second, passed Truex, Jr. to lead the first lap. On lap 26, [[Jimmie Johnson]], from starting in the fifth position, passed Kahne for the lead. As Johnson led, [[Johnny Sauter]], on lap 40, went to the garage because of electrical problems. Fourteen laps later, the [[Racing_flags#Yellow flag|caution flag]] waved as [[Sam Hornish, Jr.]] collided with the [[SAFER barrier|wall]] because of a flat tire. All the lead-lap driver came on pit road for their first [[pit stop]]s. After finishing the pit stops, Johnson led them to the green flag on lap 59. One lap later, [[Kyle Busch]] passed Johnson for the lead.<ref name=summ /> [[File:KyleBuschAugust2007.jpg|thumb|220px|right|Race winner [[Kyle Busch]] in 2007]] Kyle Busch kept the lead until lap 85 when Jimmie Johnson passed him. On laps 125 through 137, green flag pit stops were occurring. The leaders during the pit stops were [[Kurt Busch]] and [[Jeff Burton]]. Johnson, then regained the lead from Burton on lap 137; the rest of the top five were Kyle Busch, [[A. J. Allmendinger]], [[Joey Logano]], and [[Tony Stewart]]. As Johnson led on lap 157, [[J. J. Yeley]] went to the garage due to engine problems. On lap 165, the second caution flag waved because [[Marcos Ambrose]] collided with the wall. All lead lap cars made pit stops; Johnson remained the leader. On lap 170, Johnson led the field to the green flag, but one lap later, Kyle Busch passed Johnson for the lead.<ref name=summ />
Kyle Busch led until Johnson passed him on lap 176. The green flag stayed out until lap 255, when Marcos Ambrose collided with the wall to bring out the third caution. On the [[Rolling start (Motorsport)|restart]], on lap 231, Jimmie Johnson led the field to the green flag. On lap 234, Kyle Busch passed Johnson, but two laps later, Johnson reclaimed the lead. On lap 245, Sam Hornish, Jr. collided with the wall, which brought out the fourth caution. All lead lap cars pit, most getting fuel and two tires, but [[Matt Kenseth]] stayed out. From staying off pit road, Matt Kenseth led the field to green on lap 250. On lap 261, Johnson reclaimed the lead from Matt Kenseth. Marcos Ambrose, who collided with the wall twice, announced that he was out of the race on lap 279.<ref name=summ />
On lap 287, the fifth caution came out because Kurt Busch collided with the wall in turn four. All the leaders made pit stops, most getting four tires and fuel. On lap 291, Jimmie Johnson led the field to the green flag. One lap later, Kyle Busch passed Johnson for the lead. Kyle Busch led until lap 353, when Johnson passed him, but for the next two laps Johnson and Busch switched the lead until Johnson claimed it. On lap 364, [[David Reutimann]] became the leader, as Johnson and Kyle Busch made their green flag pit stops. On lap 365, Martin Truex, Jr. passed Reutimann for the lead. One lap later, it was announced that Jimmie Johnson, who led the most laps, received a penalty for speeding on pit road. On lap 367, Kyle Busch reclaimed the lead. Kyle Busch kept the lead to win his second race of [[2010 NASCAR Sprint Cup Series|2010]] and his eighteenth win in his Sprint Cup Series career.<ref name=summ />
